poem:
"Incidental Ballet on Runway Tarmac"

Two metal birds on Heathrow's stage,
Danced a clumsy, steel-wrought ballet.
Wings reaching in an accidental exchange,
Notes of alarm in the rhythm of disarray.
Caught in the spotlight of morning's hue,
Two jesters in the aerodrome view,
Cloaked in livery of Virgin and BA,
Their ellipse graceless in the cold light of day.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Two passenger planes clip wings on Heathrow runway Two passenger planes clipped wings on the runway while one of the aircraft was being towed at Heathrow. Footage on social media shows the wing of a Virgin Atlantic plane overlapping the wing of a British Airways aircraft while emergency services surround the area at the UK’s busiest airport. The Virgin Boeing 787-9 plane had just landed and was being towed by a separate private company to". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
